author: Barry Estabrook
title: Summer Books: Food
text:
You would think that everything that can be said about cooking over fire has been said. After all, humans have been preparing food that way for some two million years. Yet every spring, publishers roll out legions of new grilling cookbooks, some of which make important contributions to the genre.
Like the previous entries in his sumptuously produced How to Cook Everything series, Mark Bittman’s “How to Grill Everything” (Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, 568 pages, $30) brings together more than a thousand recipes and variations....
